intro: Pyrus aria proles cyclophylla, commonly known as the cyclophylla pear, is a rare and distinctive cultivar of the pear tree. It belongs to the genus Pyrus in the family Rosaceae, characterized by its showy, double flowers and edible fruits. The plant is notable for its unique leaf morphology and the presence of cyclophylla, a specific type of fruiting structure. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts interested in rare plant species.
